official-title.#text:
To expedite and oversee the implementation of the women in service implementation plan, and for
			 other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: makes the following findings:

text.#text:
On January 24, 2013, Secretary of Defense Leon Panetta and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
			 Martin Dempsey rescinded the 1994 Direct Ground Combat Definition and
			 Assignment Rule and directed the Armed Forces to open closed occupations,
			 positions, and units to female members of the Armed Forces no later than
			 January 1, 2016.

The rescission of the 1994 policy was based on the knowledge that success in the Armed Forces
			 results solely from a member’s ability, qualifications, and performance,
			 and the decision to rescind the policy is consistent with America’s values
			 and enhances military readiness.

quote.#tail:
reality that female members of the Armed Forces, particularly in Iraq and Afghanistan, have been
			 serving in combat.

text.#text: The change in policy is reflective of the

quote.#tail: to be used to assess and assign members not later than September 2015.

text.#text: The largest number of closed occupations, positions, and units are in the Army and

header.#text: Removal of artificial barriers to the service of women in the Armed Forces

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall not unduly delay the assignment of female members
			 of the Armed Forces to military occupational specialties, positions, and
			 units because of the absence of a cadre or critical mass of female members
			 available for such assignment.

header.#text: Cadre or Critical Mass Not Required

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 direct the Secretaries of the military departments to open for assignment
			 of women to all positions in occupations that, on or after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, are open to female members of the Armed Forces in
			 any unit of the Armed Forces.

text.#text: As soon as possible after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

header.#text: Validation and oversight of gender-Neutral occupational standards

shall

header.#text:
Improved leadership and responsiveness in implementation of the women in service implementation
			 plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall direct the Secretaries of the military departments to provide
			 greater transparency of its women in service implementation plan, ensure
			 that a statement of administration policy is created to reflect the
			 mission of the implementation plan and its intent on responsibly opening
			 all jobs, positions and units to female members of the Armed Forces.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall promptly respond whenever the Secretary of a military
			 department submits a notice of newly opened jobs, positions, of units to
			 female members of the Armed Forces and avoid any delays in transmitting
			 such notices to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the Secretary of Defense

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure all closed positions and units are open to female members of
			 the Armed Forces no later than January 1, 2016, consistent with the Joint
			 Memorandum issued on January 24, 2013, regarding the elimination of the
			 1994 Direct Ground Combat Definition and Assignment Rule.

text.#text: Effective upon the enactment of this Act, any female member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall permit female members of
			 the Army to apply to Army Ranger School as Ranger School is not solely

text.#text: Effective upon the enactment of this Act, the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall direct each Secretary of a military department to take immediate
			 steps to ensure that properly designed and fitted combat equipment is
			 available and distributed to female members of the Armed Forces under the
			 jurisdiction of that Secretary.

header.#text: Review of outreach and recruitment efforts focused on officers

shall—

text.#text: In conducting the review under

identify and evaluate current initiatives the Armed Forces are using to increase accession of women
			 into the officer corps;

identify new recruiting efforts to increase accessions of women into the officer corps specifically
			 at the military service academies, Officer Candidate Schools, Officer
			 Training Schools, the Academy of Military Science, and Reserve Officer
			 Training Corps; and

identify efforts, resources, and funding required to increase military service academy accession by
			 an additional 20 percent by the end of the four-year period beginning on
			 the date of the enactment of this Act.
